00013  *  Local constants and enumerated types.

00016 #define hdidefs_h

00018 //#include "hp/hpudefs.h"
00019 #include "mm/mmudefs.h"
00020 
00021 /* Async HDLC achieves data transparency at the byte level by using
00022  * two special values. The first is a flag value which begins and ends
00023  * every packet: 
00024  */
00025 #define  DLL_FLAG      0x7e
00026 
00027 /* The flag value might appear in the data.  If it does, it is sent as
00028  * a two-byte sequence consisting of a special escape value followed by
00029  * the flag value XORed with 0x20.  This gives a special meaning to the
00030  * escape character, so if it appears in the data it is itself escaped
00031  * in the same way. 
00032  */
00033 #define  DLL_CTRL_ESC  0x7d
00034 #define  DLL_ESC_MASK  0x20
00035 
00036 /* The number of buffers in each HD pool is defined here */
00037 #define HDDATABUFCNT  4   
00038 
00039 /* Memory Pool Definitions */
00040 #define HDMAXMESSAGE  1024          /* Max message size */
00041 #define HDRXPOOLSZ    20            /* # blocks in the pool */
00042 #define HDRXBUFSIZE   HDMAXMESSAGE  /* Size of each block in the pool */
00043 #define HDALLOCATE    TRUE          /* Allocate from the free pool */
00044 #define HDNOALLOCATE  FALSE         /* No need to allocate a buffer */
00045 
00046 /*************
00047  *
00048  * Name:    hdtxchrstate
00049  *
00050  * Purpose: These are the per character state machine states.
00051  *             
00052  * Members: HDWAITPKT - Wait for the start of a packet 
00053  *          HDDATA    - handle regular data
00054  *          HDESCAPED - handle escaped data
00055  *
00056  * Notes:   This state machine provides all the data link layer transmit 
00057  *          capabilities - start and end flags, escaping of data
00058  *
00059  **************/
00060 enum hdtxchrstate
00061 {
00062     HDWAITTXPKT = 0,
00063     HDDATA,
00064     HDESCAPED
00065 };
00066 
00067 /*************
00068  *
00069  * Name:    hdrxdllstate - Receive task character state machine      
00070  *
00071  * Purpose: These are the state machine states.
00072  *             
00073  * Members: WAIT_FOR_SYNC  - Waiting for a flag to start a packet 
00074  *          SYNCED_NO_DATA - Have a flag, expecting the packet to start
00075  *          COLLECT_DATA   - In the middle of a packet 
00076  *          ESCAPED        - ESCAPED, char needed
00077  *
00078  * Notes:   none
00079  *
00080  **************/
00081 enum hdrxdllstate 
00082 {
00083     WAIT_FOR_SYNC = 0, /* Waiting for a flag to start a packet       */
00084     SYNCED_NO_DATA,    /* Have a flag, expecting the packet to start */
00085     COLLECT_DATA,      /* In the middle of a packet                  */
00086     ESCAPED            /* ESCAPED ,char needed,                      */
00087 };
00088 
00089 /*************
00090  * 
00091  * Name:      hdSendblk
00092  *  
00093  * Purpose:   Provides a structure for framing outbound data requests
00094  *
00095  * Members:   hddata  - The data portion of the structure, an array of 
00096  *                      bytes large enough to hold the longest framed
00097  *                      HIP message.
00098  *
00099  * Notes:     None
00100  *
00101  *************/
00102 struct hdSendblk {
00103     swi_uint8 hddata[2*HDMAXMESSAGE];
00104 };
00105 
00106 /*************
00107  * 
00108  * Name:      hdreq
00109  *  
00110  * Purpose:   Provides a structure for hd request blocks.
00111  *
00112  * Members:   hdsendblkp - Pointer to a send block structure 
00113  *            hdpacketp  - Pointer to a data packet.
00114  *            hdpacketsz - Size of data packet 
00115  *            hdsendcfp  - send completion call back function 
00116  *            hduserp    - user parameter for call back function
00117  *            hdusersendfp - user-provided send function
00118  *            hdfcs      - FCS passed in by user
00119  *                      
00120  * Notes:     none
00121  *
00122  **************/
00123 struct hdreq {
00124     struct hdSendblk *hdsendblkp;
00125     swi_uint8 *hdpacketp;
00126     swi_uint16 hdpacketsz;
00127     void (*hdsendcfp)(void *userp, swi_uint8 *bufp, swi_bool errorflg);
00128     void *hduserp;    
00129     void (*hdusersendfp)(swi_uint8 *bufp, swi_uint32 pktsize);
00130     swi_uint16 hdfcs;
00131 };
00132 
00133 
00134 /*************
00135  *
00136  * Name:    hdtxCtlBk
00137  *
00138  * Purpose: Control structure for transmitting packets through the HD facility
00139  *             
00140  * Members: hdtxdllstate  - data link state
00141  *          hdtbufpool    - OS memory pool structure for allocating memory for
00142  *                          packets to be Tx through the HD package
00143  *          hdtreqpool    - OS memory pool structure for allocating memory for
00144  *                          request blocks to be Tx through the HD package
00145  *          hdttxHoldBufferp - pointer to allocated buffer space for output data
00146  *          hdttxHoldBufferPosp - pointer to current location in the HoldBuffer
00147  *          hdtxpktsdropped - number of tx packets dropped 
00148  *
00149  * Notes:   none
00150  *
00151  **************/
00152 struct hdTxCtlBk
00153 {
00154     enum hdtxchrstate hdtxdllstate;
00155     struct mmpool hdtbufpool;
00156     struct mmpool hdtreqpool;
00157     swi_uint8 *hdtHoldBufferp;
00158     swi_uint8 *hdtHoldBufferPosp;
00159     swi_uint32  hdtxpktsdropped;
00160 };
00161 
00162 /*************
00163  *
00164  * Name:    hdRxCtlBk - Serial receive task Port control block 
00165  *
00166  * Purpose: This structure contains Port related data.
00167  *             
00168  * Members: hdrdllstate      - data link engine state
00169  *          hdRxPool         - Memory pool control structure for Rx Pool
00170  *          hdOutoffset      - Offset into hdRxPool blk
00171  *          hdrMemrelp       - ptr to addr. to use when releasing hdRxPool buf
00172  *          hdrHoldBufferp   - ptr to allocated space for storing received data
00173  *          hdrHoldBufferEndp - ptr to current copy location in buffer
00174  *          hdrerror         - state engine error
00175  *          hdrdatavalid     - flag valid character returned from state engine
00176  *          hdrendframe      - flag end of frame encountered
00177  *          hdrdatacount     - state engine data counter
00178  *          hdrxready        - flag for port ready checks
00179  *
00180  * Notes:   none
00181  *
00182  **************/
00183 struct hdRxCtlBk
00184 {
00185     enum hdrxdllstate hdrdllstate;
00186     struct mmpool hdRxPool;
00187     swi_uint32 hdOutoffset;
00188     swi_uint8 *hdrMemrelp;
00189     swi_uint8 *hdrHoldBufferp;
00190     swi_uint8 *hdrHoldBufferEndp;
00191     swi_bool  hdrerror;
00192     swi_bool  hdrdatavalid;
00193     swi_bool  hdrendframe;
00194     swi_uint16 hdrdatacount;
00195     void     *hdrnuserp;
00196     swi_bool hdrxready;
00197 };
